title.native: 彼女がフラグをおられたら

description: Hatate Sota is a high school boy, who has an ability to visualize "flags" for future events such as "death flag", "friendship flag", and "romance flag". Despite the flag-viewing ability, he avoids making friends with others due to a trauma he experienced in a ship submergence accident. Four beautiful girls get interested in his strange way of living, and they begin to live with him at the school dorm by force.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B8%A1%E8%BE%BA%E6%AD%A9)

Ayumu Watanabe is a director, screenwriter, storyboard artist and a former animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.

**Height:** 145 cm (4'9")
**Nicknames:** Ao-chan (あおちゃん), Kodomo sensei (こども先生, lit. Child teacher)
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)
- Renne Bright - Eiyuu Densetsu: Sen no Kiseki IV (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Hajimari no Kiseki (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Kuro no Kiseki (VG)
- Yurusen - Kamen Rider Ghost (VG)
- Fiona - Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (VG)
- Rita Rossweisse - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Moddey - Memento Mori (VG)
- Futaba Sakura - Persona 5/Royal (VG)
- Pascal - NieR: Automata (VG) (VG)
- Nian - Arknights (VG)
- Istina - Arknights (VG)
- Ravi & Apocalyptic Ravi - Epic 7 (VG)
- Schneider - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lysithea - Fire Emblem: Three Houses (VG)
- Cinderella - Nikke: Goddess of Victory (VG)
- Sugar - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)

**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV

[Profile](https://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/832/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/nana-monky/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Suwa_Ayaka) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/suwa_ayaka/)

She is a voice actress. On January 1st, 2023, she announced in her twitter account her marriage with mangaka [Kotoba Inoya](https://anilist.co/staff/123014).

**Non anime roles:**
• Florence - Memento Mori (VG)
• Lucy - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
• Shorekeeper - Wuthering Waves (VG)

**Birth Name:** Kana Harada (原田佳奈)
**Height:** 161 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/0812asumikana)

**Non-Anime Roles**
• Bronya Zaychik (Honkai Impact 3rd)
• Bronya Rand (Honkai: Star Rail)
• Silver Wolf (Honkai: Star Rail)

__Height:__ 157 cm 

[Agency Profile](https://inari-inc.com/talent/yoko-hikasa/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hikasayoko-official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hikasayoko_official/) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@hikasayoko_official) | [(Old) Twitter](https://twitter.com/hikasayokoSP)

Co-hosted the popular weekly radio show Odoroki Sentai Momonoki Five (おどろき戦隊モモノキファイブ) with fellow seiyuu [Eriko Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/103983) from 2009 to 2017.
She got married to a person from outside the industry in 2015.
On September 5, 2024, she announced that she was starting her own voice talent agency, [i.nari](https://inari-inc.com/), which would also be representing her going forward.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Neve - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Red Hood - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Celia - Tevi (VG)
- Emilie - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Judith Lanster - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
- Brigitta Lycaon - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Vita - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Saeki Kazuko - YanOta: The Delinquent and the Otaku (Drama CD)
- Evelyn Chevalier - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

__Height:__ 156 cm (5'1")

[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/hanazawakana/) | [Website](http://www.hanazawakana-music.net/) | [Website 2](http://www.hanazawakana-music.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanazawa_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hanazawa_kana.official/)  | [YouTube]( https://www.youtube.com/@hanazawa_kana/) | [Radio page](https://www.joqr.co.jp/qr/program/dekirukana/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@hanazawa_kana.official)

__Introduction__
Kana Hanazawa is a voice actress, actress, singer, former child actress, and talent represented by Office Osawa. In July 2020, she married fellow voice actor [Kensho Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/95819), whom she had been dating since 2017. 

__Early Career__
Hanazawa originally became a child actress at the age of 8. Amongst other roles, she starred in the well-known TV school show _Appare Sanma Daisensei_ and the TV series _Gakkou no Sensei_. At that time she was contracted to Big Apple, and later to Five Eight and Smile Monkey.

__Voice Acting Career__
At the age of 14, she made her voice acting debut in 2003 as Holly in _[Last Exile](https://anilist.co/anime/97/)_. Three years later in 2006, she was selected for a major role in TV Tokyo's anime mecha series _[Zegapain](https://anilist.co/anime/878/)_. She was playing the main character's childhood friend, [Kaminagi Ryouko](https://anilist.co/character/2578/), and her performance was one of the main reasons for the character's popularity amongst fans. It was afterwards that she came under contract at prestigious voice acting talent agency Office Osawa in 2007.

Hanazawa went to university in 2007, while at the same time, she began to make her mark as a voice actress. She was voted in 2010 as "Best Female Voice Actress" by listeners of the radio program Nonko and Nobita's Anime Scramble. She graduated from university in 2011, and in the same year became a full-time voice actress.

Hanazawa won Best Supporting Actress at the 9th Seiyuu Awards for her role as [Kosaki Onodera](https://anilist.co/character/52723/) in _[Nisekoi](https://anilist.co/anime/18897/)_. She also won Newtype's Best Voice Actress award in 2015 and later in 2018.

__Music Career__
On February 23, 2012, it was announced that Hanazawa would launch her official website. A few days later, during the Kana Hanazawa Solo Debut Presentation Party event, it was announced that she would release four singles within a year: "Hoshizora Destination" on April 25, "Hatsukoi no Oto" released on July 18, "Happy Endings" on October 24 (an ending theme for _[Zetsuen no Tempest](https://anilist.co/anime/14075/)_), and "Silent Snow" on January 16, 2013. Her first album Claire was released on February 20, 2013, and her second album 25 was released on February 26, 2014. She released an album title Blue Avenue in April 2015 and went on a concert tour starting at the Nippon Budokan on May 3. The Blu-ray release of the show, Live Avenue Kana Hanazawa in Budokan, ranked number six in sales.

__Trivia__
- She was invited to Anime Festival Asia 2010 on stage.
- She used to be a junior idol in Akihabara where hundreds of people came to watch her, which is how she got her breakthrough for her acting career in commercials before becoming a voice actress.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Marie](https://anilist.co/character/89069/Marie) - Persona 4 Golden (VG)
- Hakari Atsuko - Blue Archive (VG)
- Illya - Memento Mori (VG)
- Marian - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Modernia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Alice Kuonji (Caster) - Fate/Grand Order (VG)

__Doujinshi Circle:__ apricot+

[Website](http://ap.sakuraweb.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/umeaoki)

Ume Aoki is a Japanese manga artist, illustrator and dōjin artist from Hyogo Prefecture. She officially romanizes her name as aokiume. She illustrates under the pennames apricot+ for many of her dojinshi, and Apply Fujimiya for the visual novel Sanarara.

Episode 12 - It's a Cruel World. I'm Going to Take a Look in the Shadows.
